intro: Dorstenia cayapia var. opifera, commonly known as the Cayapia mountain fig, is a tropical flowering plant native to the Amazon basin. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often tubular inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
